title: DENV NS1 inhibits IFN-β production
null_hypothesis: DENV NS1 protein has no effect on IFN-β production in infected cells.
alternative_hypothesis: DENV NS1 protein significantly inhibits IFN-β production in infected cells.
rationale: Analysis shows NS1 has high propagation weight with MAVS and IRF3, which are critical for IFN-β induction. Experimental data shows decreased phosphorylation of IRF3 in the presence of NS1, suggesting inhibition of interferon signaling. This may represent a viral mechanism to subvert host immune response.
experimental_data_used: IRF3 phosphorylation levels, protein interaction weights from propagation analysis
experimental_validation: Measure IFN-β production in cells expressing NS1 vs control cells after stimulation
Assess IRF3 phosphorylation and nuclear translocation in presence/absence of NS1
Perform co-immunoprecipitation to detect direct interaction between NS1 and MAVS/IRF3
